title: Doctor Strange is never late
body:
Tony: Stephen. You’re late.

Stephen: No, I think you will find I am right on time.

Tony: Like hell you are, I’ve been waiting for… *checks watch*….you…..how…

Stephen: Yes? What time is it?

Tony: You really have to stop doing that.

reblog.comment:

Stephen: No, I think you will find I am right on time.

Tony: You really have to stop doing that.

Stephen: Yes? What time is it?

Tony: You really have to stop doing that.

Stephen: No, I think you will find I am right on time.

Stephen: Yes? What time is it?

Tony: You really have to stop doing that.

question: Favourite iron man movies scenes?
answer:
sorry this took so long but i had to think about it, here we go:

my absolutely favorite scene is the whole car racing in monaco, followed by pepper and happy arriving on the scene screaming horrified at tony; peak comedy + perfect outfit 11/10

then there is the pepperony scene in iron man one, at the party, when tony and pepper finally sort of admit their interest in each other; pepper saying “i need a martini, with olives, t w o olives” is a mood, tony left her on the balcony tho so 9/10

then there is the final scene of iron man 3, i mean— the whole final part from the arrival of all tony’s suits to pepper killing killian like a pro; pepper kicking ass + tony secretly turned on by it + rhodeytony scenes + pretty colors 10+/10

then there is the scene of natalie/natasha meeting tony for the first time; natasha kicking ass + flustered tony because a pretty girl smiled at him + tony obviously trying to make pepper jealous 10/10

title: Me and Mine
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2vM6nhi

by sleepsick

The woman turned to Peter, and now he could tell she was a doctor. Something about the eerie steadiness of her eyes.

“I’m going to cut right to the point. Peter is an exceptional omega. The first we’ve encountered in this district like him under the age of forty.”

Omega.

Peter had to stop himself from curling up on the seat.

(Or: a young Peter Parker is recruited by the Avengers, but for a special purpose.)

Words: 2194, Chapters: 1/?, Language: English

  • Fandoms: Marvel Cinematic Universe, The Avengers (Marvel Movies)
  • Rating: Explicit
  • Warnings: Rape/Non-Con, Underage

summary: I think what people don't realize about the whole Ultron ordeal was that it was going to happen whether or not Wanda was brought...
body:
I think what people don’t realize about the whole Ultron ordeal was that it was going to happen whether or not Wanda was brought into the equation. Tony made it very clear in Age of Ultron that he had been planning and building Ultron for a while. The only thing Wanda did in showing Tony the vision was speed up the process. Ultron becoming evil was inevitable because he was corrupted by the Mind Stone, which Tony planned to use the whole time, so the only way they could have avoided it was to convince Tony not to make him. Wanda causing Tony to make Ultron quicker had literally nothing to do with why he went bad.

The only ones technically at fault for it were Tony and Bruce, but I would argue that that was extremely indirect because neither of them knew Ultron would become the literal opposite of what they intended. The only real thing I think Tony is at fault for is messing with the scepter beyond what he told Thor he would and risking an Ultron 2.0 by making Vision (which still doesn’t settle right with me tbh). Other than that, none of them should be blamed for the events in Age of Ultron.

The only ones technically at fault for it were Tony and Bruce, but I would argue that that was extremely indirect because neither of them knew Ultron would become the literal opposite of what they intended. Other than that, none of them should be blamed for the events in Age of Ultron.

I think what people don’t realize about the whole Ultron ordeal was that it was going to happen whether or not Wanda was brought into the equation. Tony made it very clear in Age of Ultron that he had been planning and building Ultron for a while. The only thing Wanda did in showing Tony the vision was speed up the process. Ultron becoming evil was inevitable because he was corrupted by the Mind Stone, which Tony planned to use the whole time, so the only way they could have avoided it was to convince Tony not to make him. Wanda causing Tony to make Ultron quicker had literally nothing to do with why he went bad.

The only ones technically at fault for it were Tony and Bruce, but I would argue that that was extremely indirect because neither of them knew Ultron would become the literal opposite of what they intended. The only real thing I think Tony is at fault for is messing with the scepter beyond what he told Thor he would and risking an Ultron 2.0 by making Vision (which still doesn’t settle right with me tbh). Other than that, none of them should be blamed for the events in Age of Ultron.
trail.content:
I think what people don’t realize about the whole Ultron ordeal was that it was going to happen whether or not Wanda was brought into the equation. Tony made it very clear in Age of Ultron that he had been planning and building Ultron for a while. The only thing Wanda did in showing Tony the vision was speed up the process. Ultron becoming evil was inevitable because he was corrupted by the Mind Stone, which Tony planned to use the whole time, so the only way they could have avoided it was to convince Tony not to make him. Wanda causing Tony to make Ultron quicker had literally nothing to do with why he went bad.

The only ones technically at fault for it were Tony and Bruce, but I would argue that that was extremely indirect because neither of them knew Ultron would become the literal opposite of what they intended. The only real thing I think Tony is at fault for is messing with the scepter beyond what he told Thor he would and risking an Ultron 2.0 by making Vision (which still doesn’t settle right with me tbh). Other than that, none of them should be blamed for the events in Age of Ultron.
